#summary This page summarizes the benchmarks of xhaskell-library performance

= Benchmarks =

This page summarizes the benchmarks of xhaskell-library performance, using a few examples.


==  The US Address Pattern ==

In this example, we use regex to extract the US addresses from an address book file.
The pattern will match address in format of <ADDRESS> <STATE CODE> <ZIP CODE>,
e.g. Mountain View, CA 90410.


||Text.Regex.PDeriv||Text.Regex.PDeriv.TwoPasses||Tex.Regex.PDeriv.Reverse||Text.Regex.Posix||Text.Regex.PCRE||Text.Regex.PCRELight||Text.Regex.TDFA||
||4.71s/51MB||2.87s/53MB||1.81s/43MB||19.31s/48MB||1.87s/52MB||272.80s/45MB||18.86s/16MB||
